intro: Rhynchosinapis cheiranthos var. montana, commonly known as the mountain mustache cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and the inflorescence consists of clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The species is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting local pollinators.
